text: Niger competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Niger entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Albachir Mouctar |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:00.15 |112 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |29.45 |83 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Alassane Lancina |align=left|50 m freestyle |25.33 |=99 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m backstroke |30.01 |66 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Roukaya Mahamane |align=left|50 m freestyle |33.71 |94 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:21.51 |92 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Niger at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Niger at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
